events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their car at an intersection, causing significant damage to the front bumper and hood.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial accident description and reported damages.
An agent was assigned to the case to assist the customer throughout the claim process and coordinate inspections.
The claim acknowledgment was sent promptly to the customer confirming receipt and explaining next steps clearly.
The customer was requested to submit photos of the vehicle damage and a police report to facilitate the assessment.
The customer submitted all requested documents including detailed photographs and the official police collision report.
The claim investigation began to review vehicle damages, accident circumstances, and liability aspects.
The investigation confirmed the accident details and verified that the customer was not at fault for the collision.
A fair settlement amount was proposed to the customer based on assessed damage repair estimates and policy coverage.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the timely settlement proposal and professional handling of the claim.
The claim was approved as all required evidence was provided and the policy coverage was confirmed for the damages.
The settlement payment was processed and issued to the customerâ€™s bank account without delays or issues.
The claim was officially closed following confirmation that the customer received the payment and was satisfied.
All claim documents and communications were archived securely for future reference and auditing purposes.
